projects.title: Member of the project: Collaborative Networks for Sustainability (RAAK)
projects.description: Collaborative networks for sustainability are emerging rapidly to address urgent societal challenges. By bringing together organizations with different knowledge bases, resources, and capabilities, collaborative networks enhance information exchange, knowledge sharing, and learning opportunities to address these complex problems that cannot be solved by organizations individually.

profile_positions.description: This module covers new strategic approaches to services by discussing innovative disruptive business models. The course strongly builds on the knowledge gained from various disciplines such as marketing, strategic management, and HRM.
profile_positions.title: Lecturer: Business Models and Services in a Digital World

profile_positions.description: Business Processes and Analytics is an interdisciplinary minor which gives you in depth knowledge and tools to analyze, describe and optimize processes within companies with the use of SAP ERP. The focus is on the integration of logistical, financial, IT, marketing and HRM processes and the theoretical knowledge thereof.
profile_positions.title: Lecturer: HRM -ERP/SAP Software solution & Analytics

profile_positions.description: The CCE project reflects all the various disciplines in the International Business program, concerning marketing & sales, management & leadership, economics, financial management, research, trade and logistics, and, of course, entrepreneurship. All these disciplines are applied in the start-up of a real company. As such many of the program's competencies are applied and tested this level.
profile_positions.title: Lecturer: Co-Creative Entrepreneurship 1 & 2

profile_positions.description: This course discusses the role of Human Resource Management in today’s international organizations and we zoom in on the so-called Human Resource Management instruments: workforce planning, recruitment and selection, compensation & benefits, training & development, and performance management. We examine how these instruments can be used to build and maintain a successful workforce, support and drive change within the organization.
profile_positions.title: Lecturer / Course coordinator: Global Human Resource Management

profile_positions.description: This module focuses on the understanding of employee behaviors and attitudes that contribute to organizational success or failure. Throughout the course, the students will identify factors that influence employees, the processes by which these factors exert their influence, and ways of applying this knowledge within organizations. The content of the course is built around 6 themes. Those are individual behavior, person-organization fit (selection, match, value congruence, corporate culture), teams, diversity, work-life balance, and motivation.
profile_positions.title: Lecturer: Contemporary Topics in Organizational Behavior

profile_positions.description: ITM is an introductory course about the basics of management theory, to give students an understanding of management and its various aspects. Different topics are discussed, including managerial functions and skills, historical perspective of management, managing in the dynamic external environment, strategy formulation and implementation, organizational structure, decision-making, leadership, human resource management, and motivation.
profile_positions.title: Lecturer: Introduction to Management

profile_positions.description: The thesis supervisor guides the student to come up with a feasible research question and work plan. So that the student will in principle be able to independently complete the research project. As a supervisor, I am responsible for evaluating the progress with special attention to research methodology and the work plan that is part of the process.
profile_positions.title: Thesis Supervisor - International Business

profile_positions.description: As an Internship assessor, I am responsible for conducting behavioral and portfolio assessments. Assessing whether a professional student meets the required professional competencies. The internship enables students to put into practice what they have learned over the past years. In addition, it offers students the experience of combining work and learning in a real company/organization.
profile_positions.title: Internship Assessors -International Business

profile_positions.description:
Coaching/ Feedback on the elements of professional skills:
Students practice in real life by creating short videos in which they present their elevator pitch on their personal qualities, ambitions and presentation skills.
profile_positions.title: Professional Skills Coach
